title: Bronze isn't Elo Hell.
body:
1. Elo Hell doesn't exist.
2. If it did, Platinum would be elo hell because players are both a) too arrogant and cocky to play as a team and b) players aren't bad enough to solo carry against.
3. If Bronze was Elo Hell, then why did it take me a week to get my 2nd smurf account out of Bronze and a mere fortnight to get nearly every person I pre-make with out of Bronze?

Elo Hell is a myth perpetuated by people with the wrong mindset, lack of knowledge and lack of skill to climb. The only people who thoroughly believe they are in elo hell shouldn't really even be playing ranked for the sake of their teammates. If you're such a god at your role/champion and you're losing after stomping lane it's probably because you let the other lanes bleed out instead of transitioning into the next phase(s) of the game.

You need to check yourself. Get the right mindset, and then find like-minded friends to pre-make with. They don't even have to have good mechanics. Knowledge and game sense is more than enough to get you to gold.

replies.body: Or maybe you just hard carried every game like a plat smurf

https://i.gyazo.com/4767e9ae480830f9321b61c894c945ac.png

There's plenty of games where I did hard carry on things like Vi, Fizz and Yi but that right there is 5 Wins as Support in a row. I'll even admit that some games I did poorly in lane phase and play super safe so that other people could carry. A big difference between High and Low Elo is whether people 'bleed out'.

E.g. A Diana was getting smashed by an Annie who eventually took over the game. The Diana, after 2 deaths and no items purchased, committed to getting Nashor's tooth when at any point she could have got a Catalyst/RoA and Abyssal and just held her own and still been relevant. And that Diana had something like 80k+ mastery.

You can be a god at a champion and never even get out of Bronze if you have a shit attitude and no common sense.

Wait that makes Elo hell actually exist?

While this post is useless (it's basically a known fact) it doesn't make it any less true.

Elo hell tends to be a mental state, or a simple fact of a person not admitting that they need to learn to play better.
Bronze isn't ELO Hell. It's Hell.

the elo system itself is elo hell. you can consistently do well but still lose more often than not simply because your teammates perform below par. this can be at any rank, diamond or bronze, and because the system only looks at win/loss it labels you as 'not good enough for this rank' and tries to do everything it can to de-rank you by rewarding you with less points for a win than it takes away for a loss etc. it does this even though you may actually be one of the top players in the matches (both micro and macro). this may be short term (usually the case) or long term.

don't get me wrong, the reverse can also be true. 'elo heaven' where someone consistently performs below par but manages to win more games than not because they get carried by teammates.

the thing is that people are usually more oblivious to the 'elo heaven' and take notice far more when they experience the 'elo hell'. ie. you never hear anyone post about winning/being promoted because they got carried but you do hear people complain about losing/being demoted even though they did well.

tl;dr shit system. needs to be fixed.

here is an idea, every fucking person has their own elo hell, ever thought of that? ever person has a ranking that they cannot reach due to certain circumstances. sure, elo hell is temporary and once you get skilled enough you get out of it.... into the next one. here is a game: http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2104746640/226564070?tab=overview
who was the best player on the blue team? did he carry his teammates? yes. keep in mind that this is bronze 1 elo, now, did the jungler ignore the other lanes? no, just look at their assists, since he has the most kills. lets look at damage, did the damage dealers do their job? no. i firmly believe that elo hell exists, but the conditions are that it is temporary until you reach a certain skill point, and that it is the place where you are obviously better than your teammates but cannot carry them alone due to solo Que being unpredictable when matching people up.

All divisions are elo hell it just depends on the luck of the draw if you get a good team or not. Ever since dynmaic queue its been hit or miss. Today has been hell. Yesterday wasn't too bad.

There is no elo hell, just players with more experience/game knowledge who are better working in with randoms. You can have godlike micro and korean style macro rotations, but if you soloq and can't work in with the 4 other randoms then it means nothing.

Dynamic que is part of the problem now allowing 4 players to group together was a terrible idea, it never should have been implemented in oce especially taking in consideration our small population.
